headline: In Michigan, Old Classmates Reckon With a Divided Country
text: From a gauzy distance, Kevin Swift describes his high school years in the 1980s in Kalamazoo, Mich., as a carefree time of basketball games, English classes and beer parties. “We had it great there,” said Mr. Swift, who is Black and grew up in a majority-white neighborhood.
snippet: The Michigan city, like the state, is a battleground of cultural and racial tensions. I should know: I grew up there.
